oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Congressional resolution honoring former President Andrew Johnson upon his death
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Resolution of Congress of the United States, Forty-Fourth Congress, First Session, on motion by Mr. McFarland, to convey sympathy to the family of former President Andrew Johnson, deceased, and "further mark of respect for the memory of the deceased, this House do now adjourn."
Johnson died while visiting his daughter Mary's residence near Elizabethton, Tennessee, on July 31, 1875. William McFarland was a Congressman from Tennessee, 1875-1877, representing Greene County.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McFarland, William, 1821-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Reconstruction (U.S. History, 1865-1877); United States. Congress. House.; United States. Congress. House -- Resolutions
